title: Partial pressure of an equal mass mixture of gases

content.question: Equal masses of three different ideal gases, X, Y, and Z, are mixed in a sealed rigid container. If the tem­perature of the system remains constant, which of the following statements about the par­tial pres­sure of gas X is correct?

choices.label: It is equal to ⅓ the total pressure
It depends on the intermolecular forces of at­trac­tion between molecules of X, Y, and Z.
It depends on the relative molecular masses of X, Y, and Z.
It can be calculated with knowledge only of the volume of the container.

content.answer: It depends on the relative molecular masses of X, Y, and Z.

skill.text: 4.C: Explain the connection between particulate-level and macroscopic properties of a substance using models and representations.
